entries.title: Microsoft says it will bring Call of Duty to Nintendo
entries.description: The Xbox maker said that if federal regulators approve its acquisition of Activision Blizzard, it will publish Call of Duty to Nintendo platforms for 10 years.

entries.title: Congress drops media bargaining bill amid Facebook, industry blowback
entries.description: The Journalism Competition and Preservation Act would have allowed publishers a temporary exemption from antitrust laws to negotiate jointly for the use of their content by the large tech companies.

entries.title: Amazon, Uber ads appear on Twitter pages of white nationalists restored by Musk
entries.description: Ads from Amazon, Uber, Snap and other major brands were appearing on white nationalist and extremist accounts.

entries.title: Top Twitch creator endorses platform connected to crypto gambling site
entries.description: Tyler “Trainwrecks” Niknam announced ambitious plans to, in his words, “make the live streaming world better.” The news was met with skepticism.

entries.title: Musk’s brain implant company reportedly investigated over animal deaths
entries.description: Neuralink, which is developing a brain implant to treat neurological conditions, reportedly has killed 1,500 animals involved in tests since 2018.

entries.title: Finding myths and meaning in the lo-fi world of ‘Dwarf Fortress’
entries.description: After 20 years of development, the 1.0 version of "Dwarf Fortress" is out. The game provides players with endless stories — if they can master its menus.

entries.title: The voices left out of Elon Musk’s free-speech agenda
entries.description: Elon Musk has said little about what Twitter should do to give people a voice when their own governments do not want people to have it. Look at China and Iran.

entries.title: What is ChatGPT, the viral social media AI?
entries.description: ChatGPT is a conversational AI project from OpenAI that's been generating funny and sometimes insightful answers to questions.
